Posts.Content: Open RP 2-18-2014. Gleason 9 with SVI and perineural invasion. Persistent PSA post op at .13 then .2 Now psa is .26 Thoughts? Jeff
Posts.Title: Decisions

Posts.Content: The VA continues to move slowly. Original diagnosis 8-26-13, Gleason 8, PSA 8.4, age 60. Had appt with surgery but resident referred me to radiation oncology. Oncologist did DRE, we had a conversation and he agreed that RP was a reasonable option for me. On November 4th, 2013 went to preop appointment. Resident noticed my biopsy had been reviewed and Gleason changed to 4 cores positive Gleason 9 then bounced right back to Rad Onc. Went to that appointment and Doc said "I won't touch you" because I was enrolled in Bay Pines System ( I was referred to Maimi by my local urologist who had confidence in the surgeons at Miami VAMC). To make a long story short, I saw my local urologist last week and we both agreed that RP and Adjuvant therapy prn was still a reasonable choice. My preop now is not until Jan 24, 2014. I worry that this aggresssive cancer is busy doing its work while I wait and wait and wait. Very worried and frustrated Jeff
Posts.Title: Delay

Posts.Content: 6 days post op. T3b. Gleason 9, 40% of both lobes. Seminal vesicle invasion on left, negative lymph nodes. I was initially very happy, but the more research I do the less hopeful I become regarding the high probability of psa recurrence and the need for RT/ADT
Posts.Title: Seminal Vesicle Invasion

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone
Posts.Title: update; biopsy downgraded from 5+4 to 4+3 (hurray), but spread to seminal vesicles

Posts.Content: Post open RP. Surgery 2-18 at Miami VA. Kicked me to curb after less than 24 hours. Took a painful 3 hour shuttle ride home.Told then I didn't feel ready. Lots of pain, bleeding from catheter. They apparently damaged some pelvic nerves. My right inguinal region is completely numb and I get these "bring you to your knees" electric shocks with any movement at all....especially when going from sitting to standing. Thought I was going to puke yesterday the pain was so horrible.
Posts.Title: Ouch

Posts.Content: Nobody to talk to on weekend. Urology clinic closed at VA. Most of my pain is from likely pelvic nerve damage, Right inguinal. Nowhere near incision, catheter is bothersome but i am dealing with it
Posts.Title: Ouch

Posts.Content: Open RP 2-18-14 Biopsy post op Gleason 9, +SVI, peri-neural invasion other margins neg Attempt to spare right nerve bundle made. Operative note from VA is not clear PSA one month, 2 months, and 4 months post op were. 0.2, 0.1, 0.2 The evidence is not clear as to whether Salvage Radiation would be of any benefit to me and would add complications. I am still struggling with incontinence but it is slowly improving. Anybody in a similar boat? Oh, I am 60

Posts.Title: The VA

Posts.Content: Adrenal lesions could be benign adrenal adenoma (in the presence of a previously elevated cortisol). Liver foci could be cystic or hemangiomas....but in the presence of Gleason 8 PC, I worry Jeff
Posts.Title: The VA

Posts.Content: Diagnosis pf Prostate Ca 2 weeks ago 65% of two cores 4+4 60% of one core 4+3 Abnormal DRE Gleason 8 t2b Wow the VA is moving slow. I am thinking time is of the essence Thanks
Posts.Title: The VA

Posts.Content: From time of diagnosis...will be nearly 90 days to get surgery slot at Miami VA. Had what radiologist described as "significant abnormalities-attn needed." Specifically small foci in liver with intrahepatict duct dilitation. Prominent pancreatic duct. Subcentimeter ovoid lesions in both adrenals. Apparently my VA urologist was not impressed and I had to make a nusance of myself to get and MRI scheduled (which isn't until November 21st) Frustrated Jeff
